description: Define the sequence S(a(0),a(1)) by a(n+2) is the least integer such that a(n+2)/a(n+1) > a(n+1)/a(n) for n >= 0. This is S(3,9).
links: Colin Barker, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..1000
maple: A022020 := proc(n)    option remember;    if n <= 1 then        op(n+1,[3,9]) ;    else        a := procname(n-1)^2/procname(n-2) ;        if type(a,'integer') then            a+1 ;        else            ceil(a) ;        fi;    end if;end proc: # _R. J. Mathar_, Feb 10 2016
prog: (PARI) a=[3,9]; for(n=2,30,a=concat(a,a[n]^2\a[n-1]+1)); a \\ _M. F. Hasler_, Feb 10 2016
author: _R. K. Guy_
extensions: Double-checked and extended to 3 lines of data by _M. F. Hasler_, Feb 10 2016
